reviews.review: So many die in this film and it seems like it's too light hearted about it. Worst hero movie I've every been to. No hope.
The single-handed best film iv'e ever seen. Very few things are wrong with it and defiantly not enough to lower it from a five star rating.
Loved it! They did an amazing job of pulling so many characters and plot lines together. What a tough job. It was exciting and entertaining.
If you think Pirates of the Caribbean 2 is a delight, then you will love this movie. Just another 2.5 hour set up for the next film.
The hype lives. Completely well done, visceral and throughoutly enjoyable.

10 years,18 movies and 72 characters all lead up to this one movie.It was all leading up to this after 10 years in the making thanks to Kevin Feige well-oiled marvel universe, And I'm gladly here to tell you that Avenger infinity war is a really good film except for some of the minor problems which are some of the characters were not put in the spotlight but I see why they could not do this because they just had 2 hours 40mins and tremendous amount of characters but you don't  realise this until you are trying to find yourself after the ending of this movie, the ending is one of the most breath taking movie events in history. Thanos is well present as a mad Titan as he is one of most powerful marvel movie villain till this date and is the only villain that breaks Marvels bad villain curse because you can see during the movie what chaos he can actually bring to the universe.All the characters are given as much of screen time they can get but truly own each scene they are in, unfortunately, All of the characters split up into teams for the majority this film but the meet up at one point or another.

I would highly recommend this movie to everyone, please bring a box of tissues to Avengers Infinity War because this is truly a culmination of the 19 films that came before.
An epic half to *hopefully* a great whole.

It was a good movie.... but I will say that a mild spoiler alert is in order.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
Not even George R.R. Martin could pull off a sadistic stunt that huge.

I had to see it a second time to fully appreciate what the Russo brothers had done: they crafted the best possible ensemble superhero movie ever, with lots of characters and lots of action and the best Marvel villain ever. I really have to see it again. And again.

This movie was unbelievably good for the gargantuan task the Russo brothers had ahead of them in balancing all of these interesting characters, giving them each their moments to shine, and hitting the perfect balance of humor with darkness.

The ending has balls for days and I feel like this movie completely made up for my disappointment with The Last Jedi. Marvel just keeps KILLING it!
